keel.Algorithms.Lazy_Learning

Class LazyAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • keel.Algorithms.Lazy_Learning.LazyAlgorithm
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CamNN, CenterNN, CPW, CW, Deeps, DeepsNN, IDIBL, KNN, KNNAdaptive, KSNN, KStar, LazyDT, LBR, NM, NSC, NumericalNaiveBayes, PW

    public abstract class LazyAlgorithm
extends java.lang.Object
    File: LazyAlgorithm.java A general framework for Lazy Learning Algorithms. This class contains all common operations in the development of a Lazy Learning algorithm. Any Lazy algorithm can extend this class and, by implementing the abstract "evaluate" and "readParameters" method, getting most of its work already done.
    Since:
    JDK1.5
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Written by Joaquin Derrac (University of Granada) 13/11/2008, Modified by Joaquin Derrac (University of Granada) 10/18/2008

                             int[] clasesTrain,
                             double[][] test,

        Set the training and the test dataset with their classes given as argument.
        Parameters:
        train - training dataset given.
        clasesTrain - training examples classes.
        test - test dataset given.
        clasesTest - test examples classes.
        clases - number of classes.

      • evaluate

        protected abstract int evaluate(double[] example)
        Evaluates a instance to predict its class. Must be implemented in the subclass.
        Parameters:
        example - Instance evaluated
        Returns:
        The class predicted. -1 if the instance remains "Unclassified"

      • evaluate2

        protected double[] evaluate2(double[] example)
        Evaluates a instance to predict its class probabilities.
        Parameters:
        example - Instance evaluated
        Returns:
        Vector with the probability for each class.
